definition: camp/barracks/battalion/to build/to operate/to manage/to strive for
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc

sentences.english: These indicated that splits had occurred in the enemy camp.
sentences.chinese: 這些說明敵人營壘已出現了分裂。

sentences.english: Pray that God will break the stronghold of persecution and corruption in China.
sentences.chinese: 禱告神會打破中國迫害及腐敗的堅固營壘。

sentences.english: Now let us discuss the situation in the camp of China's national revolution.
sentences.chinese: 現在我們來說中國民族革命營壘裏的情形。

sentences.english: God and pull down the strongholds.
sentences.chinese: 然後用神話語的寶劍攻破這些營壘。

sentences.english: The traitors were spat on and cursed by the people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

sentences.english: It marked a split within the Kuomintang camp.
sentences.chinese: 這是國民黨營壘的破裂。

sentences.english: This camp of traitors are deadly enemies of the Chinese people.
sentences.chinese: 這一賣國賊營壘是中國人民的死敵。

definition: Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
armed enemy of the nation/enemy of the Emperor/fig. championship challenger/contender opposing champion in sporting contest
Vertical Alliance, clique of the School of Diplomacy 縱橫家|纵横家[Zong4 heng2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (425-221 BC)
to sacrifice one's life by loyalty (to one's prince, one's husband etc)
the State of Qǐ in modern Qǐ county 杞縣|杞县, Henan (c. 1500-445 BC), a small vassal state of Shang and Western Zhou for most of its existence
to go on a hunting expedition
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
to be in overall charge/to oversee
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
